DOC.brief_summary: The objective study compare early polyarticular juvenile idiopathic arthritis ( JIA ) efficacy , safety , cost-benefit-ratio three treatment strategy : biologic combination , combination conventional disease-modifying drug ( DMARDs ) , methotrexate alone .
DOC.brief_title: Aggressive Combination Drug Therapy Very Early Polyarticular Juvenile Idiopathic Arthritis
DOC.detailed_description: DMARD-naive polyarticular JIA patient early disease ( onset less 6 month ) randomize one three treatment strategy : ( 1 ) biological combination , i.e. , anti-TNF therapy infliximab plus methotrexate ; ( 2 ) Combination DMARDs methotrexate , sulfasalazine , plus hydroxychloroquine ; ( 3 ) Methotrexate alone . The efficacy evaluate American College Rheumatology Pediatric ( ACR Pedi ) criterion base 6 core set variable ( CSVs ) : 1. active joint ; 2. . joint pain tenderness limitation motion ; 3 . ESR ( mm/hr ) ; 4. Childhood Health Assessment Questionnaire ( CHAQ ) ; 5 . Physician 's Visual Analogue Scale ( VAS ) ; 6 . Patient/Parent VAS . To fulfill ACR Pedi 75 criterion , 3/6 CSVs improve 75 % 1/6 CSV worsen 30 % . All direct indirect cost document . The first phase study open-label clinical trial last 54 week . In second phase study patient follow 5 year , long-term outcome early aggressive therapy analyze . Serum , urine , saliva sample collect 3 5 year translational research .
